@LPP2014 @DWFireRescue @DorsetCouncilUK @HealthyDorset @EnvAgency @dorsetpolice @DSFireUpdates 10 pumps queing on chickerell road to get to site, one aerial ladder on the road, another aerial one on the site plus God knows how many pumps on there at the moment!
@qwag @Sutcliffe_Park @EnvAgencySE @Thames21 @johnjimson @Royal_Greenwich Good to hear. A couple of weeks ago it was quite choked
RT @DWFireRescue: Fire @DorsetCouncilUK Crookhill Depot, Chickerell, #Weymouth now under control. But there has been significant damage. No‚Ä¶
RT @DWFireRescue: Fire @DorsetCouncilUK Crookhill Depot, Chickerell, #Weymouth now under control. But there has been significant damage. No‚Ä¶
@mike_r_edwards @Sutcliffe_Park @EnvAgencySE @Thames21 @johnjimson @Royal_Greenwich https://t.co/AKbSqfa8kG

@mike_r_edwards @Sutcliffe_Park @EnvAgencySE @Thames21 @johnjimson @Royal_Greenwich Do you mean at this end of the #RiverQuaggy? It‚Äôs understandable that debris would collect at the river‚Äôs exit of the park. It didn‚Äôt look too bad at the time. Not enough to cause a major blockade, at least not today. Will keep an eye on.
RT @DWFireRescue: Fire @DorsetCouncilUK Crookhill Depot, Chickerell, #Weymouth now under control. But there has been significant damage. No‚Ä¶

@Sutcliffe_Park @EnvAgencySE @Thames21 @qwag @johnjimson I wonder if @Royal_Greenwich have actually got around to clearing the outflow in the north west corner. It was blocked with a huge amount of debris that was drastically reducing flow out of Sutcliffe Park and needs to be sorted.
RT @DWFireRescue: Fire @DorsetCouncilUK Crookhill Depot, Chickerell, #Weymouth now under control. But there has been significant damage. No‚Ä¶
RT @DWFireRescue: Fire @DorsetCouncilUK Crookhill Depot, Chickerell, #Weymouth now under control. But there has been significant damage. No‚Ä¶
RT @EnvAgencyNW: ‚ö†Ô∏èAn updated forecast means there are still 8 #floodwarnings and 11 #floodalerts in place on coastlines across the #NorthW‚Ä¶

With more rain forecasted we getting to very high level of flood via River Quaggy, normally river is about four feet below bridge. But floods do recede quickly. Not had flood gates shut yet by @EnvAgencySE, @Thames21 @qwag pic by @johnjimson https://t.co/1fF9zB7glJ
RT @DWFireRescue: Fire @DorsetCouncilUK Crookhill Depot, Chickerell, #Weymouth now under control. But there has been significant damage. No‚Ä¶

RT @DWFireRescue: Fire @DorsetCouncilUK Crookhill Depot, Chickerell, #Weymouth now under control. But there has been significant damage. No‚Ä¶
RT @DWFireRescue: Fire @DorsetCouncilUK Crookhill Depot, Chickerell, #Weymouth now under control. But there has been significant damage. No‚Ä¶

Fire @DorsetCouncilUK Crookhill Depot, Chickerell, #Weymouth now under control. But there has been significant damage. No reported injuries so far, but please remain vigilant and follow @HealthyDorset advice. Thanks also to @EnvAgency @dorsetpolice @DSFireUpdates CFOüöíüëç https://t.co/EtbTIaGSsU
@EnvAgencyAnglia who do I contact about how we might agree to removing flood banks along the Stour?
RT @EnvAgencyNW: ‚ö†Ô∏èAn updated forecast means there are still 8 #floodwarnings and 11 #floodalerts in place on coastlines across the #NorthW‚Ä¶
@EnvAgencyAnglia Need to get some Beavers up there

RT @EnvAgencySE: There are several flood warnings and alerts in place across the South East...

You can check your flood risk and keep up w‚Ä¶
RT @Geraint_Smith: Numbers of salmon & sea trout in rivers of Britain & Europe have crashed to only 7% of those present 50 years ago, acc 2‚Ä¶

text: @Neil04357329 @DrElaineKing @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @NickMolho Yes, we need better enforcement - but more funding for the EA & other agencies is the precondition for getting that.

@DrElaineKing @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ShaunSpiers1 @NickMolho Funding is good, but implemented powers is better. Organisations such as @EnvAgency need to exercise powers they already have (which they‚Äôre not currently).  Just look at state of #chalkstreams

@LewesNibbler The raised path on the west bank of the river seems to be keeping water out of the flood plane and pushing it into town - was this what @EnvAgency intended to happen ? @zoenicholson4 seems crazy to me

.....but I'm always one to find solutions. How about it @DefraGovUK @TonyJuniper @EnvAgency @YorkshireWater - how do get better at getting the money to where it matters easier and qucker? https://t.co/G5Kq1nqKr3

@RTFphotos @BeaverTrust @ninaconstable @sophiepavs @jaowallace @NatureTrustEU @HFFnature @kernowbeaver @gow_derek @rcampbellpalmer @fishinguideuk @DefraGovUK @Lukesteele4 @slowtheflow_UK @treesponsibilit @CrownTrees @YorkshireiCASP @EnvAgencyYNE @ScottAPatient Thanks @RTFphotos for the tag - it's definitely something we are interested in and may have future relevance to the #caldervalley (which for those who aren't familiar is heavily affected by flooding). We will try to make the screening and if not we will watch the recording.

@LymoTweetUp @EnvAgency @Lymingtontimes @KenWhistance Flooding even! Although flooring works too...!
@LymoTweetUp @EnvAgency @Lymingtontimes @KenWhistance Oh, dear! I was walking along the sea wall between Lym and KH this morning and lots of flooring. This is bonkers though!

The latest river level for Cookham Lock is 19cm and rising. @EnvAgencySE tends to call a Flood Alert at 20cm. We can keep up to date by registering for flood alerts by text, phone or email. Latest Cookham flood info. at Cookham Flood Warnings blogspot https://t.co/BDBUl8Nt2A

urls.title: Your Granada Weather Forecast | ITV News
urls.description: The Granada ITV Weather Team bring you Today's ITV Weather forecast for the North West of England and the Isle of Man.

text: VIDEO: #weather for NW England and the #isleofman @GranadaReports https://t.co/cw8Rx5dgoJ beware high tides in the Isle of Man & at Irish Sea coasts. @EnvAgency has flood alerts and warnings out along Irish Sea coasts at high tide especially (which I think is around 11pm) #byebye https://t.co/RQwZrPzJml
